title: Tesat optical terminals selected for Lockheed Martin satellites pass ground tests
summary: Tesat-Spacecom’s laser communications terminals passed key ground tests required to be deployed on Space Development Agency satellites, the company announced Oct. 26.

title: Avio Just Needs Some Space from Arianespace
summary:
Italian rocket builders Avio have asked the European Space Agency to allow it to split from Arianespace and independently market its Vega launch vehicles. The request was first reported by La Tribune. The request, which is backed by the Italian government, will be on the agenda at the ESA Space Summit in Seville, Spain, on […]
The post Avio Just Needs Some Space from Arianespace appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: Daily Telescope: Snapshot of a brilliant green comet before it left forever
summary: "My goal was to highlight the comet's journey."

title: Shenzhou-17 crew arrives at Tiangong space station
summary: Three new astronauts have arrived at China’s Tiangong space station following launch from the Gobi Desert late Wednesday.

title: China Launches New Space Station Crew
summary: China launched a new crew to the Tiangong-3 China Space Station this evening EDT. The three-man Shenzhou-17 crew will replace three others who have been aboard since May, continuing their […]

title: ABL Space Systems prepares for second RS1 launch
summary: ABL Space Systems is moving into the final phases of preparations for the second launch of its RS1 rocket after the company’s first launch failed in January.

title: Speaker Mike Johnson: “The People’s House is Back in Business”

title: Rocket Lab projects Electron return to flight in fourth quarter
summary: Rocket Lab is preparing to return its Electron rocket to flight before the end of the year as it completes an investigation into a launch failure in September.

title: Terran Orbital hosting town hall meeting to revive flagging shares
summary: Terran Orbital will address shareholder concerns about its growth prospects in a virtual town hall event Oct. 26 during what is usually a quiet period for a public company just weeks away from announcing earnings.

title: Rocket Lab expects to resume Electron launches before year-end after September failure
summary: Rocket Lab expects to resume launches of its Electron vehicle before the end of the year, the company announced on Wednesday.
